docs.snippet: The military-run government is running out of time to guarantee a credible process for selecting the nation’s first president since the ouster of Hosni Mubarak....
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that Egypt's military-run government is running out of time to guarantee a fair and credible vote in the presidential election; urges authorities to finalize a list of candidates and establish firm and transparent regulations for the voting process; expresses hope that Egyptians do not choose extremist Islamic Brotherhood candidate Mohamed Morsi.
docs.lead_paragraph: The military-run government is running out of time to guarantee a credible process for selecting the nation’s first president since the ouster of Hosni Mubarak.

headline.print_headline: Espada’s Lawyer Calls Embezzlement Charges ‘Rotten to the Core’
headline.seo: Espada’s Lawyer Calls Federal Embezzlement Case ‘Rotten’
headline.main: Espada’s Lawyer Calls Embezzlement Charges ‘Rotten to the Core’

docs.snippet: The former state senator is accused of stealing hundreds of thousands of dollars from the nonprofit organization that he founded and ran, Soundview Health Center in the Bronx....
docs.abstract: Defense delivers closing arguments to federal jury in embezzlement trial of former New York State Senator Pedro Espada Jr, who is accused of stealing hundreds of thousands of dollars from nonprofit Soundview Health Center in the Bronx.
docs.lead_paragraph: The former state senator is accused of stealing hundreds of thousands of dollars from the nonprofit organization that he founded and ran, Soundview Health Center in the Bronx.

headline.seo: At the International Furniture Fair, Social Commentary and Luxury

docs.snippet: This year’s International Furniture Fair was marked by the contradictory pursuits of social consciousness and unrestrained luxury....
docs.abstract: Objects featured at the 2012 International Furniture Fair in Milan, many of which combine socially conscious design with unrestrained luxury, include an organic LED lamp and several furnishing collections by Tokyo-based design studio Nendo.
docs.lead_paragraph: This year’s International Furniture Fair was marked by the contradictory pursuits of social consciousness and unrestrained luxury.

headline.print_headline: Equal Opportunity Panel Updates Hiring Policy
headline.seo: Equal Opportunity Panel Updates Hiring Policy
headline.main: Equal Opportunity Panel Updates Hiring Policy

docs.snippet: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission freshened a 1987 policy that says employers must strive to be fair when weighing criminal histories....
docs.abstract: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission approves an updated 1987 policy that says employers must strive to be fair when weighing criminal histories; makes it harder to use background checks to systematically rule out hiring anyone with a criminal conviction.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission freshened a 1987 policy that says employers must strive to be fair when weighing criminal histories.

headline.print_headline: Neil Finds Three Ways to Torment Rangers
headline.main: Neil Finds Three Ways to Torment Rangers

docs.snippet: Chris Neil has served as an enforcer, an agitator and a scorer for the Senators in their playoff series against the Rangers....
docs.abstract: Ottawa Senators winger Chris Neil, who has served as enforcer, agitator and scorer for the Senators in their playoff series against the New York Rangers, is preparing for decisive Game 7.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chris Neil has served as an enforcer, an agitator and a scorer for the Senators in their playoff series against the Rangers.

headline.print_headline: Gov. Scott Rounds Up the Usual Zealots
headline.seo: Gov. Rick Scott Rounds Up the Usual Zealots
headline.main: Gov. Scott Rounds Up the Usual Zealots

docs.snippet: It is outrageous that some of Florida’s most gun-friendly legislators are on a task force to examine the Stand Your Ground law at issue in the shooting of Trayvon Martin....
docs.abstract: Editorial expresses outrage that Florida Gov Scott Brown appointed some of state's most gun-friendly legislators to task force examining Stand Your Ground law, at issue in the shooting death of Trayvon Martin; calls on task force's more moderate members to work hard to ensure that the public understands the law's full record of mayhem.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is outrageous that some of Florida’s most gun-friendly legislators are on a task force to examine the Stand Your Ground law at issue in the shooting of Trayvon Martin.

headline.print_headline: Michigan: Signatures Submitted To Put Repeal of Emergency Law On the Ballot
headline.main: Michigan: Signatures Submitted to Put Repeal of Emergency Law on the Ballot

docs.snippet: Opponents of an emergency manager law have gathered enough signatures to put a repeal measure on the November ballot, a state elections staff memo said....
docs.abstract: Opponents of an emergency manager law in Michigan gather enough signatures to put a repeal measure on the November ballot, depending on vote by the State Board of Canvassers; if measure is put on the ballot, law will be suspended until the election, affecting managers in Detroit and other cities.
docs.lead_paragraph: Opponents of an emergency manager law have gathered enough signatures to put a repeal measure on the November ballot, a state elections staff memo said.

headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Budget Includes Money For Those Sterilized In Eugenics Effort
headline.main: North Carolina: Budget Includes Money for Those Sterilized in Eugenics Effort

docs.snippet: Gov. Bev Perdue called Wednesday for the state to spend $10.3 million to compensate victims of a eugenics program....
docs.abstract: North Carolina Gov Bev Perdue calls for the state to spend $10.3 million to compensate victims of a eugenics program that was run from 1929 to 1974; budget proposal would include $50,000 for each of the 132 verified victims of the forced sterilization program still living.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Bev Perdue called Wednesday for the state to spend $10.3 million to compensate victims of a eugenics program.

headline.print_headline: Oregon: Study of Coal Transport Sought
headline.main: Oregon: Study of Coal Transport Sought

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. John Kitzhaber asked the federal government on Wednesday to conduct an environmental study of proposals to export coal to Asia from Montana and Wyoming through ports in Oregon and Washington.
